Which part of the neuron is responsible for receiving information from other neurons?
A. Axon
B. Dendrites
C. Soma
D. Synapse

B. Dendrites

Dendrites are the branch-like extensions of a neuron that receive information from other neurons. They increase the surface area available for receiving signals, allowing a neuron to connect with many other neurons. The information received by dendrites is then transmitted to the cell body (soma) of the neuron.
